Tue. 03/09~~~Food for thought~~~It's not to late to obey His Commission...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Feed My Sheep." (Jn. 21:17b)

Our Lesson for Today:

This is love in the making. The love of God is not created--it is His nature...

When we receive the life of Christ through the Holy Spirit, He unites us
with God so that His love is demonstrated in us. The goal of the indwelling 
of the Holy Spirit is not just to unite us to God, but to do it is such a way
that we will be one with the Father in exactly the same way Jesus was...

So what kind of oneness did Jesus Christ have with the Father???

He had such a oneness with the Father that He was obedient when His Father 
who sent Him down here to be poured out for us. AND He says to us, "As the
Father has sent Me, I also send you." (Jn. 20:21)

If we truly love the Lord, we have no business being guided by natural emotions,
we have to feed His sheep...

Beware of counterfeiting the love of God by following your own natural human 
emotions, sympathies, or understandings. That will only serve to revile and
abuse the true love of God...

Prayer Suggestion:
Pray that your oneness with the Father would be like that
of Christ...
Pray that you would be obedient to God's commission, not
out of sympathy but out of Christ-like love...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Wed. 4/09~~~food for thought~~~Is this true of YOU? (Acts 20:24).

Our Bible Verse for Today:

However, I consider my life worth nothing to me, if only I may 
finish the race and complete the task the Lord Jesus has given
me, the task of testifying to the Gospel of God's grace...(Acts 20:24)

Our Lesson for Today:

It is easier to serve or work for God without a vision and without a call,
because then you are not bothered by what He requires. Common
sense covered with a layer of Christian emotion, becomes our guide...

You may be more prosperous and successful from the world's perspective, 
and will have more leisure time, if you never acknowledge the call of God.

But once you receive a commission from Jesus Christ, the memory of what 
God asks of you will always be there to prod you on to do His will. You will no 
longer be able to work for Him on the basis of common sense...

What do you count in your life as "dear to you?" If you have not been seized 
by Jesus Christ and have not surrendered yourself to Him, you will merely 
consider the time you decide to give God and your own ideas of service dear.

Paul said he considered his life dear so that he might fulfill the ministry he had 
received, and he refuses to use his energy on anything else. Paul was absolutely 
indifferent to any consideration other than that of fulfilling the ministry he had
received...

Never consider whether or not you are of use, but always consider that 
"YOU ARE NOT YOUR OWN" (I Cor. 6:19). You are His...

Prayer Suggestion:
Pray that your wants and wishes are in accord with His will.
Pray that He would strengthen you for His service...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Thur. 05/09~~~food for thought~~~Is He really Your Lord?

Our Bible Verse for Today:

However, I consider my life worth nothing, if only I may finish
the race and complete the task the Lord Jesus has given me,
the task of testifying to the Gospel of God's grace...(Acts 20:24).

Our Lesson for Today:

Our joy should come from seeing the complete fulfillment of the specific
purpose for which we were created and born again, not from successfully 
doing something of our own choosing...

The Joy our Lord experienced came from doing what the Father had sent 
Him to do. AND He says to us, "As the Father sent me, I also send you" 
(Jn. 20:21).

Have you received a ministry from the Lord? If so, you must be faithful to
it, to consider your life valuable only for the purpose of fulfilling that ministry.
Knowing that you have done what Jesus sent you to do, think how satisfying
it will be to hear Him say to you "Well done, good and faithful servant"
(Mt. 25:21).

We each have to find a niche in life, and spiritually we find it when we receive 
a ministry from the Lord. But to do this we must have close fellowship with
Jesus and must know Him as more than our personal Savior...

In John 21:17 Jesus asks "Do you love Me?" Then "Feed My sheep."
If we look closely we should realize that He is not offering us a choice of how
we can serve Him; He is asking for absolute loyalty to His commission, a
faithfulness to what we discern when we are in the closest fellowship with God.

Prayer Suggestion:
Pray that you would be sensitive and faithful to do 
what God has called you to do. Pray for a closer 
fellowship with Him...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Fri. 06/09~~~food for thought~~~Ask yourself when you read the verse below,
"Is this me?"

Our Bible Verse for Today:

We put no stumbling block in anyone's path so that our ministry
(or life) will not be discredited.

Rather, as servants of God we commend ourselves in every way:
in great endurance; in troubles, hardships and distresses;
(2 Cor. 6:3, 4)

Our Lesson for Today:

When you have no vision from God, no enthusiasm left in your life,
and no one watching and encouraging you, it requires the grace of
Almighty God to take the next step in your devotion to Him...

This is what is needed in the reading and study of His Word, 
in your family life, and in your duty to Him. It takes much more
of the grace of God, and a much greater awareness of drawing
upon Him, to take that next step, than it does to preach the Gospel...

Every Christian must experience the essence of the incarnation by
bringing the next step down into flesh-and-blood reality and by working
it out with His hands...

We need to be careful so as to not lose interest and give up when we have
no vision, no encouragement, and no improvement, but only experience 
our every day trivial tasks...

The thing that really testifies for God and for the people of God in the
long run is steady perseverance, even when the work can not be seen 
by others. The only way to live an undefeated life is to live looking
to God...

Never allow yourself to think that some tasks are beneath your dignity
or to insignificant for you to do, remind yourself of the example of
Christ in (Jn. 13:1-17)

Prayer Suggestion:
Ask God to keep the eyes of your spirit open to the risen Christ,
and His example...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Sat. 07/09~~~food or thought~~~In what have you put your dependence?

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Who will bring any charge against those whom God has chosen?
it is God who justifies...

Who is he who condemns? Christ Jesus, who died, more than that,
who was raised to life, is at the right hand of God and is also interceding
for us...

Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall trouble or hardship
or persecution or famine or nakedness or danger or sword???

As it is written: "for your sake we face death all day long we are considered
as sheep to be slaughtered."

No, in all these things we are more than conquers through Him who loved us...
(Ro 8:33-37)

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul is speaking of all the things that seem likely to separate a saint from 
the love of God. But the remarkable thing is that nothing can come between
the love of God and a saint...

The things that Paul mentions in these verses can and do disrupt the close
fellowship of our soul with God and separate our natural life with Him. But 
none of them is able to come between the love of God and the soul of a Christian
on the spiritual level...

The underlining foundation of the Christian faith is the undeserved, limitless
miracle of the love of God that was exhibited on the Cross of Calvary, a love
that is not earned and can never be...

This is the reason Paul says, "in all these things we are more than conquerors."

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You Lord for the Victory we have in Jesus!

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Holy Father, keep them and care for them, all those You have 
given Me, so that they will be united just as we are...Jn. 17:11

Our Lesson for Today:

Christ is our intercessor and lives to pray this great prayer. 
Expect and appropriate God's answer...

Listen to Paul's words in I Thess.

"Night and day praying exceedingly that the Lord may establish
your hearts unblameable in holiness before God" (3:10-13)

"The very God of peace sanctify you wholly" (5:23)

Consider thoughtfully these words as you read them and use them
as a prayer to God: "Blessed Lord, strengthen my heart to be
unblameable in holiness. God Himself sanctify me wholly. God is
faithful, who will also do it."

What a privilege to commune with God in secret, to speak these
words in prayer, and then wait upon Him until through the working 
of the Spirit, they live in out hearts, and we begin to know something
of the holiness of God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Today let us pray for a holy fear and a strong desire to live
in the fullness of faith...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

3/26/09~~~food for thought~~~Remember God's loving kindness...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

"Oh, give thanks unto the Lord; for He is good:
for His mercy endureth forever." (Ps. 136:1)

Our Lesson for Today:

This particular Psalm is devoted to the praise of God's mercy:
In each of the twenty-six verses we have the expression: 
"His mercy endureth forever."

The Psalmist was full of this wonderful thought. Our hearts too
should be filled with this blessed assurance. The everlasting,
unchangeable mercy of God is cause for unceasing praise
and thanksgiving...

Please take time to read about God's mercy in the well-known
Psalm 103...

Oh, how often we read these familiar words without the least thought
of their immeasurable greatness! Be still and meditate until the heart
responds to the words of this wonderful Psalm...

Prayer Suggestion:
Take time to thank God for His wonderful mercy
and loving kindness...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

03/27/09~~~food for thought~~~Why worry when you know who is in charge...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

For the Word of God is living, and active. Sharper than any two-edged sword,
it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the 
thoughts and attitudes of the heart...(Heb. 4:12)

Our Lesson for Today:

For fellowship with God, His Word and prayer are indispensable.
In His Word, He speaks to us. In prayer, we speak to Him...

The Word teaches us to know the God to whom we pray.
It teaches us how He would have us pray.
It gives us precious promises to encourage us in prayer.
It often gives us wonderful answers to prayer... 

The Word comes from God's heart and bring His thoughts and His love into our heart.
And then the Word goes back from my heart into His great heart of love...

Yes prayer is the means of fellowship between God's heart and ours...

Prayer Suggestion:

03/30/09~~~food for thought~~~This is for those who do not believe in the Trinity...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

God the Father chose you long ago, and the Spirit has made you holy.
As a result, you have obeyed Jesus Christ and are cleansed by His blood.
(I Pet. 1:2)

Our Lesson for Today:

As we see here in this verse all three members of the Trinity are mentioned:
God the Father, God the Son (Jesus Christ), and God the Holy Spirit...

Another important fact to recognize is that all three member of the Trinity
work to bring about our Salvation...

The Father chose us before we chose Him (Eph. 1:4)...
Jesus Christ, the Son died for us while we were still sinners (Ro. 5:6-10)...
The Holy Spirit brings us the benefits of salvation and sets us apart
(makes us holy, sanctifies us) for God's service (2 Thess. 2:13)

Let us always remind ourselves that, for all our communion with
God, the presence and the power of the Son and the Spirit are
absolutely necessary...

Prayer Suggestion:
Give thanks for all that He has done for us (me) even 
before we (I) Surrendered to Him...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

03/31/09~~~food for thought~~~Let us remember with shame how little we have believed in,
and sought after, God's love...


Our Bible Verse for Today:

"God is love; and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in God,
and God in him" (1 Jn. 4:16).

Our Lesson for Today:

The best and most wonderful word in heaven is Love.
for God is Love...

And the best and most wonderful word in the inner chamber
must be-- Love. For God meets us there in Love...

What is love? It is the deep desire to give oneself for the beloved.
Love finds its joy in imparting all that it has to make the loved one happy...

And the heavenly Father, who offers to meet us in the inner chamber-let there be no doubt of this in our minds--has no other object than to
fill our hearts with His love...

All the other attributes of God that are mentioned in His Word find in this
their highest glory. The true and full blessing of the inner chamber is
nothing less than a life in the abundant love of God...

Prayer Suggestion:
As you set yourself to pray, pray for a greater faith in His ever-lasting love.
Pray that the precious truth of (I Jn. 2:1) would be a reality in your heart.
"Behold what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us."

04/01/09~~~food for thought~~~Never be to busy to give God an extra minute...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"On Thee do I wait all the Day" (Ps. 22:5).

Our Lesson for Today:

"Waiting upon God" in this expression we find one of the deepest
truths of God's Word in regard to the attitude of the soul in its
communion with God...

Waiting upon God. Just think --- maybe if we would just give Him
an extra minute He would reveal Himself to us; that He may teach us 
all His will; that He may do to us what He has promised; that in all
things He may be the infinite God...

Waiting upon God. Is an attitude of the soul --- with which each day should begin.
Upon awakening each morning, in quiet meditation, in the expression in prayer
share your deepest longings and desires. In the course of our daily work, in our 
striving after obedience and holiness, in all our struggles against sin and self-will
in everything there should be a waiting upon God to receive what He will bestow,
to see what He will do, to allow Him to be Almighty God...

Wait on God meditating on these things, and they will help you to value the
precious promises of God's Word...

They that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength...

Wait on the Lord, be of good courage, and He shall strengthen thine heart...

The deep root of all Scriptural theology is this: Absolute dependence on God.
As we exercise this spirit, it will become more and more natural and blessedly
possible to say: "On Thee do I wait all the day."

Prayer Suggestion:
Pray that each day you would take the time to
wait upon the Lord and be sensitive to His will...

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
